intro: Spiesia nigrescens, commonly known as the black-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and usually have a rough texture. Spiesia nigrescens is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
